description: Specify wall or facet group names. Use of the group logic is described in Groups documentation. By default, s is assigned to the group slot 'Default'. The optional 'facet' keyword can be given before the optional range to specify that the group name will be applied to facets. In this case, the range is applied to facets and not to walls. IMPORTANT: The 'add', 'remove', and 'slot' keywords apply to ALL walls/facets (or a previously active range), they cannot be combined with a 'range' keyword in the same command.

keywords.name: add
keywords.description: Assign group name s to the next available slot for ALL walls/facets (cannot be used with range in same command)

keywords.name: remove
keywords.description: Remove group name s from all slots for ALL walls/facets (cannot be used with range in same command)

keywords.name: slot
keywords.description: Set group slot to s. Default slot: 'Default'. Can be combined with range

keywords.name: facet
keywords.description: Apply group name to facets instead of walls. When specified, range applies to facets

examples.description: Assign all walls to group 'boundary' in default slot
Assign all facets to group 'facetassembly' in default slot
Assign all walls to group 'container' in slot 'A'
Assign walls with IDs 1-10 to group 'walls' in default slot
Remove group 'oldgroup' from all slots for all walls
Assign facets at z-position 9-10 to group 'top' in default slot
Assign walls named 'foundation' to group 'layer1' in slot 'layer'
Assign walls NOT in group 'top' to group 'bot' (from official docs)

python_sdk_alternative.workaround: Wall.set_group(group_name, slot) or Facet.set_group(group_name, slot) for setting; Wall.group_remove(group_name, slot) or Facet.group_remove(group_name, slot) for removing - requires iteration over wall/facet range
